CatDescriptText: Mr. Buzzy Ray, laborer, Third Ward and Mr. James O. Jackson, disabled janitor, LaPlace Street, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 17, 1962, pg. 7 with question: "What's wrong with the Republican party in Allegheny County?" Mr. Buzzy Ray's answer reads: "I don't know because I'm not too familiar with politics."  Mr. James O. Jackson's answer reads: "Off hand, I would say there's nothing wrong.  There's too much fighting among each other and a lack of organization."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Buzzy Ray wearing hat and eyeglasses, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of James O.Jackson wearing tweed coat, plaid necktie, and hat, standing behind open car door, in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
